Welcome to my website

About Me

I am a PhD student in the Numerical Modeling and Fluid Dynamics group at the Laboratoire J.A. Dieudonné (LJAD), working under the supervision of Professors Didier Clamond and Yves D’Angelo.

My research interests include Scientific Computing, High-Order Numerical Methods, High Performance Computing (HPC), and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD).

Preprints

  1. L. Poggioni, D. Clamond, and Y. D’Angelo. A new class of finite difference methods: The zigzag schemes. arXiv:2505.17969, 2025. [arXiv] [PDF]

Work in progress

  • Improved pseudo-spectral methods for nonlinear advection models: Developing an efficient, HPC-compatible numerical scheme featuring a spectral accuracy with enhanced stability properties for nonlinear advection problems.

  • Efficient high-order HPC finite-difference solver for the Navier–Stockes equations: Designing an arbitrary-order finite-difference scheme with optimised stability constraints for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, tailored for scalable high-performance computing implementations.

Teaching

  • Oral Examiner (Colleur) in Linear Algebra for Bachelor students.
